alert.note: Alert for Extreme Western Allegany; Garrett (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 09 at 8:46AM EST until January 09 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations ranging from 1 to 3 inches west of Route 219 with 3 to 6 inches expected along and east of Keyser`s Ridge to Bittinger. Snow accumulations of 4 to 8 are expected from Grantsville to Finzel into western Allegany County including Savage Mountain. Ice accumulations ranging from a few hundredths in western Garrett to a quarter of an inch near Keyser`s Ridge. * WHERE...Garrett and Extreme Western Allegany Counties. * WHEN...Until 2 PM EST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning commute. Snowfall rates around one to two inches per hour are possible during the morning commute on Interstate 68 from Keysers Ridge to Savage Mountain to Frostburg, increasing the potential for dangerous travelling conditions during this time. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Moderate to heavy snow from around Keysers Ridge to Savage Mountain will mix with sleet and freezing rain by 10 AM. Elsewhere, a wintry mix will continue this morning. Precipitation will change to rain early this afternoon.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
